definition: to sign one's name/visa/variant of 籤|签[qian1]

sentences.english: Fortunately, most of our water supply is renewed annually as snowpack in the Rockies.
sentences.chinese: 幸運的是，我們大部分的供水續簽每年積雪的落基山。

sentences.english: Visa renewals are no longer routine.
sentences.chinese: 簽證續簽不再如以往般輕而易舉。

sentences.english: How to deal with cases where outsourcing staff suffer from work-related injury?
sentences.chinese: 沒有續簽處於三期的婦女員工，該如何處理？

sentences.english: Some members were being told to return to their home countries in order to apply for business visa renewals.
sentences.chinese: 一些會員被告知要返回本國才能申請商務簽證續簽。

sentences.english: And the Lakers hope to sign Ariza this summer.
sentences.chinese: 並且，這個賽季結束的夏天，湖人希望續簽阿里扎。

sentences.english: Check-list of employment labor contract and renew;
sentences.chinese: 公司員工合同簽訂和續簽統計表。

sentences.english: But oil companies are still eager to get renewal discussions over with and sign deals.
sentences.chinese: 但石油公司仍渴望就續簽事宜進行討論並簽訂協議。

definition: a pass (authority to enter)/a laissez-passer or safe conduct
population (counted as number of households for census or taxation)/registered residence/residence permit/(in Hong Kong and Macau) bank account
to affix a seal/to stamp (a document)/to sign off on sth
permanent residency permit (originally referred specifically to the US green card)
to sign one's name/visa/variant of 籤|签[qian1]
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]
